setImageResource(int).Description: Sets a new image on the ImageSwitcher with the given resource id. This will set that image resource on the next ImageView in the switcher and will then switch to that view.

Parameters: Uri: the Uri of an image
setImageURI(android.net.Uri).Description: Sets a new image on the ImageSwitcher with the given Uri. This will set that image on the next ImageView in the switcher and will then switch to that view.

Parameters: Drawable: the drawable to be set or null to clear the content
setImageDrawable(android.graphics.drawab.Description: Sets a new drawable on the ImageSwitcher. This will set that drawable on the next ImageView in the switcher and will then switch to that view.

ImageSwitcher(android.content.Context,an.Description: Creates a new empty ImageSwitcher for the given context and with the specified set attributes.

getAccessibilityClassName().Description: Return the class name of this object to be used for accessibility purposes. Subclasses should only override this if they are implementing something that should be seen as a completely new class of view when used by accessibility, unrelated to the class it is deriving from. This is used to fill in @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo#setClassName_E@.

ClassDesc: @B_android#widget#ViewSwitcher_E@ that switches between two ImageViews when a new image is set on it. The views added to an ImageSwitcher must all be @B_android#widget#ImageView_E@.
